paragraphs.text:
%md
# Avro Ingest Example

This notebook contains two example commands that can be used to ingest data in the Apache Avro format. Running the commands below will ingest sample data that comes bundled with the tools distributions.

Please note the ingest commands can take a few seconds to start producing output while the JVM spins up.

msg.data:
Avro Ingest Example

This notebook contains two example commands that can be used to ingest data in the Apache Avro format. Running the commands below will ingest sample data that comes bundled with the tools distributions.

Please note the ingest commands can take a few seconds to start producing output while the JVM spins up.

paragraphs.title: Command Help
paragraphs.text:
%python
import subprocess, shlex

cmd = "/opt/geomesa/bin/geomesa-hbase help ingest"
process = subprocess.Popen(shlex.split(cmd), stdout=subprocess.PIPE)
out, err = process.communicate()
for line in out.splitlines(): 
    print(line.decode("utf-8"))

msg.data:
Usage: ingest [options] <file>...
  Options:
  * -c, --catalog
       Catalog table for GeoMesa datastore
    -C, --converter
       GeoMesa converter specification as a config string, file name, or name of
       an available converter
    -f, --feature-name
       Simple Feature Type name on which to operate
    --input-format
       File format of input files (shp, csv, tsv, avro, etc). Optional,
       autodetection will be attempted.
    --no-remote-filters
       Disable remote filtering and coprocessors
       Default: false
    --run-mode
       Run locally or on a cluster
    -s, --spec
       SimpleFeatureType specification as a GeoTools spec string, SFT config, or
       file with either
    -t, --threads
       Number of threads if using local ingest
       Default: 1
    -z, --zookeepers
       Zookeepers (host[:port], comma separated)

paragraphs.title: Run Avro ingest
paragraphs.text:
%python
import subprocess, shlex

cmd = "/opt/geomesa/bin/geomesa-hbase ingest -c catalog -s example-avro -C example-avro-no-header /opt/geomesa/examples/ingest/avro/example_no_header.avro"
process = subprocess.Popen(shlex.split(cmd), stdout=subprocess.PIPE)
process.communicate()
